trial_identification.scientifictitle: Exploring the Effects of Oxytocin on Non-verbal Communication

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Oxytocin Treatment: drugs - Placebos
Experimental: Oxytocin - 24IU Syntocinon, delivered in a single nose via a nasal spray
Placebo Comparator: Placebo - Matched nasal spray
Treatment: drugs: Oxytocin Administration of the hormone oxytocin
Treatment: drugs: Placebos

primaryOutcome.outcome: Non-verbal communication - Based on coding the video-recorded interaction between two strangers, using a coding scheme by Gonzaga et al. (for affiliative and sexual cues)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured in the interaction which commenced 45mins after drug administration

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Ratings of the person participants interacted with - Positivity or sexual attraction towards the other participant in the conversation (as measured using visual analogue scales based on person perception studies)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured following the interaction (which commenced 45 mins after drug administration)

recruitment.hospital: University of New South Wales - Sydney

ethicsAndSummary.summary: In this protocol registration, the investigators plan a secondary data analysis of a dataset to explore the effects of intra-nasal oxytocin on the non-verbal expression of affiliation.
